review: I can honestly say if this is only early access, the next Doom game has some competition This game is REALLY good for early access. Like, REALLY good. First thing I noticed was the fact that thegraphics are incredible. At least for me, because I have a pretty powerful PC. The environment is VERY Doom 3-like, however I'd say the textures are much better looking. Everything else is exactly the samein terms of appearance.Gameplay-wise it is not as good. Walking is a bit floaty and you can't jump, as Space is the 'interact'button. Gunplay works really well however. While being slow to start off the game kicks you in thenuts with a big horde of zombies at the end of the first level. However while this pumps up the gamethe general gameplay is slow.Feature-wise it is very good. You can buy different items in the in-game shop with CREDITS YOU PICK UP IN-GAME. NO MICRO-TRANSACTIONS. THANK JESUS HIMSELF. Anyways, the guns in thestore seem to be varied and they look very nice. Problems: - Had minor issues with menus over-lapping while running on my 3 monitors - No jumping - Slow gameplayWould I recommend it? YEP. Remember my comment about Doom 4 having some competition? Yeah, I was being truthful. I honestly think if the devs fix the slow gameplay, walking and lack ofjumping, this could be a classic that will be remembered for years to come.Doom, watch the f**k out.NOTE: I know I go on about how this is the next Doom-killer but I really think it has the potential to be.
